meanings.definition: To provide food and drink for a social event or gathering.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant will cater the wedding reception with delicious food.
meanings.sent2: The catering company will cater the office party next Friday.
meanings.sent3: The caterers accidentally brought too much food to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to cater to everyone's needs effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the catered meal filled the room, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: To supply what is required or desired.
meanings.sent1: The store will cater to all your needs with a wide range of products.
meanings.sent2: The company aims to cater to the demands of its customers effectively.
meanings.sent3: The helpful assistant was able to cater to the customer's specific requests.
meanings.sent4: Her speech seemed to cater to the emotions of the audience, leaving them moved.
meanings.sent5: The hotel staff went above and beyond to cater to the guest's preferences.
